sentence.text: She barged past police , threw her arms around Diana 's neck and kissed her on the cheek .
She ran round the outside of the house , barging past bushes and shrubs .
The others are always barging about the kitchen and the living-room .
` So you just barge into my bedroom and wake me up ? "
He gets a bit fussed and fidgety if I barge into his bedroom but we sometimes have these little chats on the stairs now .
The man was having a family gathering when the masked raiders , armed with a pistol and a knife , barged into his home in Knowle , Bristol .
He had barged into her house with the sole purpose of making trouble and she felt resentful and furious about that .
At that moment James Morris barged into the office without knocking , looking flustered .
` How dare you think you can just barge into my property !

It 's the time you stamp on someone 's foot , hard , when they barge past you as you smile at them innocently and say sorry .

` You barge through life , Julius , knocking people aside as you go .

I just barged up to him a few times during the evening and in the end he said , ` Alright then , let's hear you sing " and he was impressed .
I saluted then watched him as he barged along the corridor and out of the front door .
They barge around upsetting other , nervous horses and young riders .
